result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chanel Christine Segelstrom

4:26 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy   Defendant Chanel Christine Segelstrom in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Chanel Christine Segelstrom.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin.  DE wishes to waive the Preliminary Hearing.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  State indicates that the Information will mirror the criminal complaint. DE would like more time.  Court will approve Zoom appearance for ARGN.  Court confirms address. Bond continues. records.addlTxt: filed by Jeremiah Harrelson; hereby appointing Atty Harrelson. arc
filed by DA's office on behalf of VW. bph

ADDRESS INFO for Chanel Christine Segelstrom
Current: 8790 Ironwood Ave, Cottage Grove, MN 55016 United States  (Effective: 08-19-2022)
Prior: 10272 Bleeker Street, Woodbury, MN 55129

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Madison F.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond argument; bond ordered. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets STC to check status of PD appointment and to schedule prelim. Adjourned at 2:15 PM.  gll
